sentence.Network_en: Relax, smile; loosen up in mind and body and behaviour.
sentence.Network_cn: 放松，微笑。精神、身体和行为上都要放轻松。

sentence.Network_en: Loosen the bolt so the bars can be turned.
sentence.Network_cn: 松一松插销，好转动门闩。

sentence.Network_en: Young people often loosen up on the dance floor.
sentence.Network_cn: 年轻人常在舞池中放松自己。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 放字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 放手〖 letgo〗 放松〖 relax;slacken;loosen〗 放下〖 putdown;laydown〗.
我想找L开头的英文单词和中文意思_百度知道 ... loose a. 松的；宽松的 loosen vt. 解开；使松驰 lord n. 贵族；上帝，基督.
字典中解字的解释 ... (13) 晓悟;明白[ understand;know] (15) 脱去;松开[ take off; loosen] (17) 打开,开放[ open].
以l开头的英语英文单词 ... loosely 松松地，松散地 loosen 变松 lop 修剪，砍掉.

jx.jx_cn_mean: 无拘束地说，无顾忌地说

entry.def: If someone loosens restrictions or laws, for example, they make them less strict or severe.

example.ex: Many business groups have been pressing the Federal Reserve to loosen interest rates...
example.tran: 不少企业集团一直在向联邦储备委员会施压，要求其放松利率管制。

example.ex: Drilling regulations, too, have been loosened to speed the development of the fields.
example.tran: 钻探条例亦已放宽，以加速油田的开发。

entry.def: If someone or something loosens the ties between people or groups of people, or  if the ties loosen, they become weaker.

example.ex: The Federal Republic must loosen its ties with the United States...
example.tran: 联邦共和国必须疏远其与美国的关系。

example.ex: The deputy leader is cautious about loosening the links with the unions...
example.tran: 该政党的二把手对疏远与工会之间关系一事态度谨慎。

entry.def: If you loosen your clothing or something that is tied or fastened or if it loosens, you undo it slightly so that it is less tight or less firmly held in place.

example.ex: He reached up to loosen the scarf around his neck...
example.tran: 他伸手松了松脖子上的围巾。

example.ex: Loosen the bolt so the bars can be turned...
example.tran: 松一松插销，好转动门闩。

entry.def: If you loosen something that is stretched across something else, you make it less stretched or tight.

example.ex: Insert a small knife into the top of the chicken breast to loosen the skin.
example.tran: 在鸡胸上方插进一把小刀，以使鸡皮不要绷得太紧。

entry.def: If you loosen your grip on something, or if your grip loosens, you hold it less tightly.

example.ex: Harry loosened his grip momentarily and Anna wriggled free...
example.tran: 哈里的手稍一放松，安娜便挣脱出来。

example.ex: When his grip loosened she eased herself away.
example.tran: 他紧抓她的手松了一下，她便抽身而出。

entry.def: If a government or organization loosens its grip on a group of people or an activity, or if its grip loosens, it begins to have less control over it.

example.ex: There is no sign that the Party will loosen its tight grip on the country...
example.tran: 没有迹象显示该党会放松对国家的严密控制。

example.ex: The Soviet Union's grip on Eastern Europe loosened.
example.tran: 苏联对东欧的控制已经放松。

entry.def: If you say that something has loosened someone's tongue, you mean that it has made them talk about something, often when they should have remained silent.

example.ex: The wine had loosened his tongue.
example.tran: 酒一下肚，他便打开了话匣。

sentences.sentence: "The government relaxed the curfew after most of the rebels were caught"
"The rules relaxed after the new director arrived"

auth_sentence.res_content: Stir the room temperature pastry cream to loosen the mixture.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Stir the room temperature pastry cream to loosen the mixture.

auth_sentence.res_content: Then sit back and loosen your belt accordingly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then sit back and loosen your belt accordingly.

sentences.en: The medicine may loosen your cough.
sentences.cn: 这种药能减轻你的咳嗽。

jushi.english: The government's control over the newspapers has loosened in recent years.
jushi.chinese: 近年来政府已放松了对报纸的控制。
